block.p: When Elie Wiesel, a voice of humanity, peace and conscience, reluctantly concludes (Op-Ed, Jan. 24) that the Arabs want not a smaller Israel, but no Israel, it is time for the United States government to stop pressuring Israel into what would be a premature settlement leading only to another war. A new attitude on the part of the United States would be noticed by the Arab countries.

When Elie Wiesel, a voice of humanity, peace and conscience, reluctantly concludes (Op-Ed, Jan. 24) that the Arabs want not a smaller Israel, but no Israel, it is time for the United States government to stop pressuring Israel into what would be a premature settlement leading only to another war. A new attitude on the part of the United States would be noticed by the Arab countries.
Mr. Wiesel was unable to stop President Ronald Reagan from visiting the German military cemetery at Bitburg in 1985, but perhaps the new president knows better to whom to listen.
JONATHAN M. STEIN Wellesley Hills, Mass., Jan. 24, 2001
